output_list.reason: The mint function has an integer overflow vulnerability. The function adds an arbitrary amount of tokens to an arbitrary user account without any checks, which can be exploited to steal funds.
The transfer function has an integer overflow vulnerability. The function adds an arbitrary amount of tokens to a user account without any checks, which can be exploited to steal funds.
The approve function has an integer overflow vulnerability. The function allows an arbitrary user to withdraw tokens from your account, which can be exploited to steal funds.
The transferFrom function has an integer overflow vulnerability. The function adds an arbitrary amount of tokens to a user account without any checks, which can be exploited to steal funds.
The mint function is owned by only the owner, but it can be exploited if the owner is malicious. The owner can arbitrarily add tokens to any user's account, allowing the owner to steal funds.
